Class ElectricVehicle

  • java.lang.Object
    • ElectricVehicle
  • public class ElectricVehicle
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an electric vehicle (EV) fields include name, battery size, state of charge, and efficiency that can change based on outside temperature.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ElectricVehicle​(java.lang.String name, double batterySize, double stateOfCharge, double defaultEfficiency)
      Constructs a new ElectricVehicle.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double getBatterySize()
      Returns the battery size (in kWh).
      double getEfficiency()
      Returns the current efficiency
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the EV name.
      double getStateOfCharge()
      Returns the state of charge (0.15 - 1.0).
      double range()
      Calculates the EV's current range.
      void setStateOfCharge​(double stateOfCharge)
      Sets a new state of charge (0.15, 1.0).
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a formatted string describing the EV.
      void updateEfficiency​(double currentTemp)
      Updates current efficiency based on temperature(F).

    • Constructor Detail

      • ElectricVehicle

        public ElectricVehicle​(java.lang.String name,
                       double batterySize,
                       double stateOfCharge,
                       double defaultEfficiency)
        Constructs a new ElectricVehicle. Rules: - name can't be null/empty; otherwise "unknown EV" - batterySize (10.0, 150.0) - stateOfCharge (0.15, 1.0) - defaultEfficiency (0.5, 4.5) - currentEfficiency starts equal to defaultEfficiency
        Parameters:
        name - the EV name
        batterySize - the battery size (kWh)
        stateOfCharge - the state of charge (0.15 to 1.0)
        defaultEfficiency - the rated efficiency (0.5 to 4.5)

    • Method Detail

      • range

        public double range()
        Calculates the EV's current range. range = currentEfficiency * stateOfCharge * batterySize
        Returns:
        the computed range

      • updateEfficiency

        public void updateEfficiency​(double currentTemp)
        Updates current efficiency based on temperature(F). Rules: - {65.0 <= temp <= 77.0} => 100% of defaultEfficiency - {temp > 77.0 } => 85% of defaultEfficiency - {temp < 65.0 } => reduce by 1% per degree below 65, max 50% reduction
        Parameters:
        currentTemp - temperature in Fahrenheit

      • getEfficiency

        public double getEfficiency()
        Returns the current efficiency
        Returns:
        current efficiency

      • getBatterySize

        public double getBatterySize()
        Returns the battery size (in kWh).
        Returns:
        battery size

      • getStateOfCharge

        public double getStateOfCharge()
        Returns the state of charge (0.15 - 1.0).
        Returns:
        state of charge as decimal

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the EV name.
        Returns:
        name

      • setStateOfCharge

        public void setStateOfCharge​(double stateOfCharge)
        Sets a new state of charge (0.15, 1.0).
        Parameters:
        stateOfCharge - new SoC decimal

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a formatted string describing the EV. e.g. Ford MachE SOC: 50.0% Range (miles): 131.8
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        formatted string
